executive_summary: Billboard and outdoor advertising companies generate revenue through leasing advertisement space on display faces, including billboards, public transit and street furniture. Demand for the industry's services depends on trends in advertising expenditure, which makes the industry sensitive to fluctuations in consumer spending, retail sales, corporate profit and overall economic conditions. Advertisers face competition from various advertising media, with the most significant competitor being online advertisements.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic caused state and local governments to shut down businesses and enforce quarantines. Since people couldn't leave their homes, consumer spending plunged, reducing revenue for retailers, restaurants, manufacturers and other sectors. The companies in sectors disrupted by the pandemic displayed tanking revenue and profit, so their investment in advertising declined massively, reducing revenue for Billboard and Outdoor Advertisers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An Economic Recovery Has Boosted Corporate Profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As the economy opened up, consumers flush with cash because of massive government aid went on a spending spree. Surging household spending has caused corporate profit to soar throughout many industries. Since companies had lots of extra income, many have decided to strengthen spending on advertising, causing revenue for billboard and outdoor advertising companies to skyrocket recently.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Inflation and High-Interest Rates Present New Challenges for Advertisers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As inflation reached record highs in 2022, the cost of transporting and building materials increased, making it more expensive to construct and maintain billboards and other displays. The Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates in recent months to combat high inflation, pushing up the cost of borrowing. Since it has become more expensive to purchase machines, materials and structures, billboard manufacturing has stalled, presenting a threat to the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue Volatility Has Crowded Out Small Players
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic, associated economic recovery, high inflation and rising interest rates have created significant revenue volatility for billboard and outdoor advertisers during the current period. Since building and maintaining billboards and other displays are extremely expensive, small companies can't survive when revenue falls dramatically. To save face, these players have either gone into bankruptcy or merged with major players, pushing up concentration.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Trending Popularity of the Internet Will Foster a Long-Term Decline
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The internet will continue to play a significant role in consumers' lives, as internet traffic volume and the percentage of business conducted online will soar during the outlook period. Advertising via the internet is often less expensive, reaches more consumers and uses algorithms so companies can tailor to the preferences of their customer base. These factors will boost online advertising and reduce spending on all other types of ads, including those for billboards and other outdoor displays, causing revenue to continuously contract.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steadily Rising Incomes Will Create Some Revenue Streams For Advertisers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite the challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, incomes and GDP growth are poised to mount at a modest rate throughout the outlook period. Higher incomes will foster more consumer spending, increasing revenue for downstream industries (e.g., retailers, manufacturers). While many of these companies will use online advertising, some will opt for the industry's services, providing billboard and outdoor advertisers with new revenue streams. Corporate profit will also creep upward in the near future, which will encourage some companies to invest in outdoor advertising and billboards as they expand their advertising budgets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Companies Hope That Recent Innovations Will Provide New Opportunities For The Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Billboard companies will continue to put sell 3D billboards, as they simulate depth to make companies' products seem more attractive. Many players will also invest in solar-powered billboards to fight climate change. Outdoor advertising companies will increase their distribution of new logo signs, as recent innovations have permitted them to change based on the time of day or weather, making them more attractive to consumers.

industry_definition: This industry is composed of companies that create and design advertising materials for public display, including printed, painted or electronic displays. Operators may place the displays on billboards, panels, within transit vehicles, shopping malls, retail stores and other display structures or sites.
key_trends: Revenue for billboard and outdoor advertisers has been volatile during the current period. COVID-19 caused sales to tank, while the pandemic recovery caused many companies to invest more in advertising.

The industry is poised to face significant challenges during the outlook period. The increased popularity of the internet will siphon away revenue from outdoor advertising, but companies hope that innovations will make billboards and outdoor advertising more attractive.

Most of the regulations that billboard and outdoor advertisers are subject to involve setting up billboards near highways. Standards were set for billboards near highways in 1965, and construction of new ones near them was banned in 1991.

The industry receives a small amount of assistance from private and public sources. The Outdoor Advertising Association of America (OAAA) is one private organization that benefits advertisers, while companies have received help from the Federal Reserve and recent COVID-19 aid.

Demand for static and digital billboards has trended in different directions. Regulations on building billboards have decreased investment in static billboards, while the benefits of displaying advertisements using LED lights have caused spending on digital boards to surge.

Economic conditions have caused demand from some market segments to soar. High consumer spending has increased spending on billboards and other outdoor advertising from industries that rely on consumer confidence, such as retailers, restaurants and manufacturers.

The Mid-Atlantic region is known for its cities with extensive public transportation systems and high-rise structures. These factors increase demand for transit displays and wallscapes, so many billboard and outdoor advertising companies exist in this region.

Many of the nation's movies and albums are produced in the West region. Since there's intense competition in the entertainment industry in the area, demand for billboards and outdoor advertising is high.

Barriers to entry for billboard and outdoor advertisers are high, requiring heavy capital investment into large structures. These barriers inhibit entrants, which reduces competition and increases consolidation.

The popularity of digital billboards has disrupted small advertisers, as most don't have the funds to set them up. Since large players have taken advantage of these innovations and increased their market share.

Since regulations restrict how many billboards can be put up, players increase revenue by acquiring billboards. Major company Lamar Advertising did this in 2018 when it purchased more than 8,500 faces from Fairway Outdoor Advertising.

Advertisers often engage in partnerships to provide new services for their clients. Major player Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings recently announced a collaboration with Hivestack, permitting clients to expand digital advertising.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Advertisers from many different service industries purchase billboards and other outdoor advertising, including technology providers, lawyers, financial companies and other organizations. For example, lawyers, real estate brokers and financial advisers may use billboards in their local communities to spread their name.
Some healthcare companies purchase displays from billboards and outdoor advertising companies, as prescription drug and health insurance sellers seek to raise awareness about their products.

Retailers, restaurants, manufacturers (e.g., automakers), sellers of consumer goods and sole proprietorships purchase billboards and other displays to raise more awareness of their products. Since these industries rely on household spending, high consumer spending will boost investment in billboards and outdoor advertising.

Retailers, restaurants, manufacturers (e.g., automakers), sellers of consumer goods and sole proprietorships purchase billboards and other displays to raise more awareness of their products. Since these industries rely on household spending, high consumer spending will boost investment in billboards and outdoor advertising.

Companies that operate in the entertainment industry include movie studios, music labels, sports teams and amusement parks. These companies purchase billboards and transit displays to make consumers more aware of their films, music, games or attractions.

Governments don't advertise often, but they sometimes put up transit and street furniture displays, encouraging people to play the lottery or raise awareness regarding other government campaigns or programs.

Nonprofit organizations may buy billboards or set up other displays to encourage more consumers to donate to a cause. As more people donate, revenue for these organizations increases, enabling them to spend more on advertising.

Retailers, restaurants, manufacturers (e.g., automakers), sellers of consumer goods and sole proprietorships purchase billboards and other displays to raise more awareness of their products. Since these industries rely on household spending, high consumer spending will boost investment in billboards and outdoor advertising.

products_and_services.product_description: Static billboards show physical bulletins and posters to consumers and comprise nearly half of the revenue for the industry.

Advertisers have been increasingly selling digital LED billboards as technological advances have made them possible. Companies can adjust the type of content shown on these boards and shift lighting according to the time of day and season.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Street Furniture and Other Urban Fixture Displays
products_and_services.product_description: Transit displays include advertising on or in transit systems, such as the interiors and exteriors of buses, trains, subways, railway stations and airports. Street furniture displays are advertised on kiosks, public restrooms, benches, and within bus shelters.
Transit displays include advertising on or in transit systems, such as the interiors and exteriors of buses, trains, subways, railway stations and airports.

Other types of displays include wallscapes, logo signs and mall displays. Wallscapes are large displays on the sides of buildings so city dwellers can see them. Logo signs are placed on highways near exits to alert travelers of fast-food restaurants and gas stations, while mall displays are littered throughout shopping malls.

tier_1_suppliers: Billboard & Sign Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Dye & Pigment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Taxi & Limousine Services in the US
Billboard & Outdoor Advertising in the US
Wireless Telecommunications Carriers in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: An increase in consumer spending drives higher retail sales, benefiting businesses in various downstream industries.
In periods of economic contractions or low growth, marketing budgets are often one of the first areas companies cut to remain profitable.
As the percentage of services conducted online increases, companies will increasingly opt to advertise online to maximize the utility of ad spending.
Print advertising expenditure measures total yearly expenditures on advertising in magazines and newspapers. Declines in print advertising expenditure presenting a threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region includes states such as Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Ohio, and Wisconsin.

The Mid-Atlantic region is home to the most densely populated cities in the United States, including New York City, Philadelphia and Washington, DC. Since these cities contain extensive public transportation systems, demand for transit and street furniture displays is high, raising the number of establishments in the Mid-Atlantic regions.
The New England region includes states such as Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and Vermont.
The Plains region includes states such as Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, and South Dakota.
The Rocky Mountains region includes states such as Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Utah, and Wyoming.

The Southeast region is home to big states such as Florida, Georgia, Tennessee and North Carolina, which makes the region populated. Since the area contains many people, many companies will be in the region, increasing demand for advertising services. This Southeast also has many highways and roads, so there's also high spending on billboards.

The West region contains the city of Los Angeles, which is the entertainment capital of the United States and houses a significant share of industry enterprises. The prevalence of musical artists is the highest in this region, so there's a greater need to advertise since producers want to gain an advantage over their competitors, boosting the industry's penetration in the West.

regulations_points.regulation_description: This act requires that if state governments want to receive federal highway assistance, they must ensure that billboards are regulated if they are within 660 feet of a highway. These laws protect the scenic value of many highways throughout the United States. Exceptions are made for commercial and industrial areas, as they're not known for their beauty.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law builds on the Federal Highway Beautification Act by specifically outlawing new billboards in designated scenic byways. These rules constrain opportunities for billboard advertisers and make the industry very saturated.

Laws regulating billboards and outdoor advertising vary by state, city and county. Some states have outright banned billboard advertising. Other cities have tried to pass laws limiting displays that might distract drivers. New regulations against digital boards have been considered, as billboards illuminating entire residential areas are often bothersome to the local population.

Billboard and outdoor advertising companies were forced to engage in social distancing and enforce mask-wearing during COVID-19. Many advertisers also required their employees to receive the COVID-19 vaccine when it became available. These regulations have since eased.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Barriers to entry for billboard and outdoor advertisers are high, requiring heavy capital investment into large structures.
barriers_points.barrier_description: These barriers inhibit entrants, which reduces competition and increases consolidation.

barriers_points.barrier_title: The popularity of digital billboards has disrupted small advertisers, as most don't have the funds to set them up.
barriers_points.barrier_description: Since large players have taken advantage of these innovations and increased their market share.

factors_decreased_barrier: Capital poses a more significant barrier to entry since getting the materials and the machines to set up billboards are costly.

concentration_points.concentration_description: As digital billboards become more popular, companies with the funds to invest in this new technology will perform the best. Since large players have the money to adapt their practices to changing times, they've been gaining

concentration_points.concentration_title: High Barriers to Entry Prevent Fragmentation
concentration_points.concentration_description: Becoming a billboard and outdoor advertising company requires significant investment in extensive and costly structures. Since the necessary funds to purchase these structures are hefty, many individuals don't enter the industry, keeping consolidation high.

The entire country is exposed to billboards and other forms of outdoor advertising, so the industry is saturated. Small companies can't boost revenue by finding new customers, benefiting large advertisers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation costs have crept upward amid high inflation
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As billboards and other outdoor displays face wear and tear, they must be repaired, and this contributes to high depreciation costs for industry enterprises.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase expenses have remained fairly flat
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs often include materials for cleaning and repairing billboards, ink and printing materials, lights and scaffolding. Altogether these components do not account for a significant portion of industry revenue.

Companies are less likely to reduce wages during recessions because they don't want their workers to become discouraged. The industry has also grown more technical as enterprises look to hire staff with adequate knowledge to configure digital billboards and other emerging technologies, driving up wages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Capital poses a more significant barrier to entry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital poses a more significant barrier to entry since getting the materials and the machines to set up billboards are costly.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low. This is combined with a low concentration of innovation. Both factors being low suggests that new technology entry is slow and widespread, which limits the threat of disruptive threats hurting leading industry operators.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Many billboard and outdoor advertisers rely on (e.g., retailers, consumer goods sellers, restaurants) rely on high consumer confidence to grow. If consumer spending is low, companies in these industries will reduce their investment in advertising, hurting billboard companies' performance.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Corporate profit is necessary for investment in advertising
volatility_points.volatility_description: Companies with high corporate profit have lots of excess income, contributing to higher budgets, which they often use on advertising to expand potential revenue gains.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Availability of Substitutes Has the Potential to Bring Sales Down
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since online advertising is less expensive, more effective at reaching some consumers and can penetrate a wider audience, they can siphon away revenue from traditional outdoor advertisers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: REGULATION LIMITS THE GROWTH OF STATIC BILLBOARDS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Static billboards show physical bulletins and posters to consumers and comprise nearly half of the revenue for the industry. Bulletins are oversized and illuminated advertising structures that target vehicles driving on highways. Posters are smaller and located on city streets. Their intended audience is slowly moving cars and pedestrians.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DIGITAL DISPLAYS HAVE GAINED IN POPULARITY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Advertisers have been increasingly selling digital LED billboards as technological advances have made them possible. Companies can adjust the type of content shown on these boards and shift lighting according to the time of day and season.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEMAND FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DETERMINES SPENDING FOR SOME TYPES OF DISPLAYS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Transit displays include advertising on or in transit systems, such as the interiors and exteriors of buses, trains, subways, railway stations and airports. Street furniture displays are advertised on kiosks, public restrooms, benches, and within bus shelters.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: THE MARKET FOR OTHER FORMS OF DISPLAYS BENEFITS WHEN CONSUMER CONFIDENCE IS HIGH
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Other types of displays include wallscapes, logo signs and mall displays. Wallscapes are large displays on the sides of buildings so city dwellers can see them. Logo signs are placed on highways near exits to alert travelers of fast-food restaurants and gas stations, while mall displays are littered throughout shopping malls.

FAQs.question: How have economic changes influenced consumer demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Consumer spending has a significant influence on the industry's performance. When consumers spend more, businesses have larger advertising budgets.

FAQs.question: State and Local Laws
FAQs.answer: Laws regulating billboards and outdoor advertising vary by state, city and county. Some states have outright banned billboard advertising. Other cities have tried to pass laws limiting displays that might distract drivers. New regulations against digital boards have been considered, as billboards illuminating entire residential areas are often bothersome to the local population.

FAQs.question: Pandemic-Era Regulations
FAQs.answer: Billboard and outdoor advertising companies were forced to engage in social distancing and enforce mask-wearing during COVID-19. Many advertisers also required their employees to receive the COVID-19 vaccine when it became available. These regulations have since eased.

FAQs.question: Industry Assistance
FAQs.answer: LOW assistance STEADY assistance

FAQs.question: Outdoor Advertising Association of America (OAAA)
FAQs.answer: The OAAA was founded in 1891 and protects the interests of out-of-home advertisers, including companies operating in the industry. The association has more than 800 members and has received more than $500 million in donations. The organization primarily lobbies the government in Washington to provide favorable legislation to out-of-home advertisers.

FAQs.question: Does your company face significant competition from substitute goods or services?
FAQs.answer: Billboard and outdoor advertising face competition from all the other advertising platforms such as television, radio, online and social media.

FAQs.question: To what degree are your operations capital-intensive?
FAQs.answer: Billboard and outdoor advertisers are moderately capital-intensive. Intensity is increasing as digital billboards become more sought after, which requires higher expenditure initially and on maintenance and replacement.

FAQs.question: Has your company pursued merger and acquisition strategies to gain market share and improve efficiencies?
FAQs.answer: Merger and acquisitions are the main way for company's to grow since most states have limited the construction of new billboard structures.

FAQs.question: Have increased levels of technological innovation/development presented any obstacles for your company?
FAQs.answer: The rise of online and social media advertising has threatened operators. Unlike this industry, social media and online advertisers can quantify consumer exposure and effectiveness, which is increasingly in demand.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Since the rise of online advertising, digital display boards have enabled industry enterprises to stay competitive. Growing demand and raising profit margins. It has also provided a platform for the industry to develop methods to quantify exposure as well.

FAQs.question: Has the regulatory environment changed significantly during the current period, or has it remained relatively stable?
FAQs.answer: The regulatory environment has remained stable. Some critics are trying to limit the use of digital displays, but they've been unsuccessful.

FAQs.question: How does your company comply with regulatory requirements?
FAQs.answer: Regulations affect the size, shape and content of the industry's products and services. Structures or advertisements that don't comply with regulations are removed and replaced at the operator's expense.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with those of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit has remained high for the industry overall, but has ebbed and flowed in line with macroeconomic uncertainty.

FAQs.question: How has your company's profitability trended during the current period?
FAQs.answer: Profitability has trended downward because of competition from substitutes and the decline of print advertising.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to successfully negotiate with the FCC? How do you respond to changing regulatory conditions?
FAQs.answer: Effectively negotiating with lawmakers can change the size, number and visibility of displays. Most of the regulations that billboard and outdoor advertisers are subject to involve setting up billboards near highways.

FAQs.question: How does your coverage compare with that of your competitors? Are there some areas in which it is harder to provide service?
FAQs.answer: To reach a mass market, many national advertisers must be provided a variety of sites across several display forms (e.g., bulletins and posters).

FAQs.question: What can you do to increase your revenue levels? What can you do to increase the reliability of your income streams?
FAQs.answer: Having displays locked into medium and long-term contracts will ensure good cash flow for an operator.

FAQs.question: How does online retail affect your business model? Have you considered changing your revenue model and business plan to include an online platform?
FAQs.answer: Billboard advertising operators must determine which advertising methods to use, given a fixed budget. Spending on print advertising may decrease the funds available for online advertising. As consumer preferences and Information sector trends shift away from print advertising and toward digital methods, the industry has adjusted in suit.

FAQs.question: How closely do you monitor trends in advertising expenditure? How have you competed with other advertising media?
FAQs.answer: The industry is sensitive to changes in advertising expenditure, which is affected by economic conditions (e.g., disposable income, consumer spending). As economic conditions improve, businesses invest more in advertising.

FAQs.question: How does increasing corporate profit affect demand for your services? Are you able to raise prices in response to higher corporate profit?
FAQs.answer: During difficult economic conditions, marketing budgets are often one of the first areas companies cut to remain profitable. When profit improves, companies expand their advertising efforts.
